types.name: RootQuery
types.description: Root Query

fields.name: allAvailableHotels
fields.description: Search for all available hotels in one location. It's necessary to send checkin and checkout dates as well as rooms configuration to get availability info.

fields.name: availableHotel
fields.description: Search for single available hotel by its ID. It's necessary to send checkin and checkout dates as well as rooms configuration to get availability info.

fields.name: allLocations
fields.description: Search for airports, cities, countries. You can search by location name, radius on the map or rectangle on the map. If you do not specify one of these search inputs then the alphabetical dump of all locations is returned.

args.name: slugRadius
args.description: Combination of slug and radius. e.g. bratislava-slovakia-169km

fields.name: allSubLocations
fields.description: All locations in certain location. For example all airports in London

fields.name: hotelCities
fields.description:
All cities where you can find the hotels. This query can be used for
suggestions of relevant cities (search for example). Cities can be filtered
by prefix with typo tolerance. Items are sorted by prefix matching and a
number of hotels (desc). When the prefix is omitted top cities are returned.

args.name: position
args.description: Search for cities around a given position.

types.name: String
types.description: The `String` scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8 character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text.

types.name: Int
types.description: The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.

types.name: BookingConnection
types.description: A connection to a list of items.

types.name: PageInfo
types.description: Information about pagination in a connection.

fields.name: hasNextPage
fields.description: When paginating forwards, are there more items?

fields.name: hasPreviousPage
fields.description: When paginating backwards, are there more items?

fields.name: startCursor
fields.description: When paginating backwards, the cursor to continue.

fields.name: endCursor
fields.description: When paginating forwards, the cursor to continue.

types.name: Boolean
types.description: The `Boolean` scalar type represents `true` or `false`.

types.name: BookingEdge
types.description: An edge in a connection.

fields.name: node
fields.description: The item at the end of the edge

fields.name: cursor
fields.description: A cursor for use in pagination

fields.name: assets
fields.description: Static assets related to this booking.

fields.name: legs
fields.description: Flight segments, e.g. stopover, change of aircraft, etc.

types.name: ID
types.description: The `ID` scalar type represents a unique identifier, often used to refetch an object or as key for a cache. The ID type appears in a JSON response as a String; however, it is not intended to be human-readable. When expected as an input type, any string (such as `"4"`) or integer (such as `4`) input value will be accepted as an ID.

types.name: Float
types.description: The `Float` scalar type represents signed double-precision fractional values as specified by [IEEE 754](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_floating_point).

fields.name: locationId
fields.description: 3-letter IATA code of airport or internal city code.

types.name: DateTime
types.description: A date-time string at UTC, such as 2007-12-03T10:15:30Z, compliant with the `date-time` format outlined in section 5.6 of the RFC 3339 profile of the ISO 8601 standard for representation of dates and times using the Gregorian calendar.

fields.name: ticketUrl
fields.description: URL of the electronic ticket. Ticket may not be available yet (returns null).

types.name: Leg
types.description: Leg is the operation of an aircraft from one scheduled departure station to its next scheduled arrival station.

inputFields.name: from
inputFields.description: From where you want to fly?

inputFields.name: to
inputFields.description: To where you want to fly?

inputFields.name: date
inputFields.description: When do you want to leave?

inputFields.name: returnDate
inputFields.description: When do you want to return?

inputFields.name: lat
inputFields.description: Latitude of the center of the circle.

inputFields.name: lng
inputFields.description: Longitude of the center of the circle.

inputFields.name: radius
inputFields.description: Distance in kilometers.

types.name: DateInput
types.description: You always have to setup exact date OR range from-to.

inputFields.name: exact
inputFields.description: Exact date (cannot be used in combination with from-to fields).

inputFields.name: from
inputFields.description: Start of the date range (cannot be used in combination with exact date).

inputFields.name: to
inputFields.description: End of the date range (cannot be used in combination with exact date).

types.name: Date
types.description: A date string, such as 2007-12-03, compliant with the `full-date` format outlined in section 5.6 of the RFC 3339 profile of the ISO 8601 standard for representation of dates and times using the Gregorian calendar.

inputFields.name: currency
inputFields.description: An ISO-4217 currency code.

types.name: Locale
types.description: Language tag in the format of the RFC 5646.

inputFields.name: from
inputFields.description: Minimum number of hours of stopover duration.

inputFields.name: to
inputFields.description: Maximum number of hours of stopover duration.

types.name: FlightConnection
types.description: A connection to a list of items.

types.name: FlightEdge
types.description: An edge in a connection.

fields.name: node
fields.description: The item at the end of the edge

fields.name: cursor
fields.description: A cursor for use in pagination

fields.name: legs
fields.description: Flight segments, e.g. stopover, change of aircraft, etc.

fields.name: bookingUrl
fields.description: URL to the Kiwi.com for booking the flight.

types.name: HotelsSearchInput
types.description: You must provide lat/lng combination OR city ID.

inputFields.name: latitude
inputFields.description: Latitude in float format (example: 45.4654).

inputFields.name: longitude
inputFields.description: Longitude in float format (example: 9.1859).

inputFields.name: cityId
inputFields.description: Opaque ID of the city.

inputFields.name: starsRating
inputFields.description: List of hotels classes (stars) you want to filter.

inputFields.name: minPrice
inputFields.description: Show only hotels having minimum total price lower than or equal to this value.

inputFields.name: maxPrice
inputFields.description: Show only hotels having minimum total price higher than or equal to this value.

inputFields.name: hotelFacilities
inputFields.description: Show only hotels having specified hotel facilities

inputFields.name: minScore
inputFields.description: Show only hotels having minimum review score higher than or equal to this value. Score must be between 1 and 10.

inputFields.name: freeCancellation
inputFields.description: Show only hotels having free cancellation.

inputFields.name: airportShuttle
inputFields.description: Show only hotels having airport shuttle as a service.

inputFields.name: familyRooms
inputFields.description: Show only hotels having family rooms.

inputFields.name: facilitiesForDisabled
inputFields.description: Show only hotels having facilities for disabled.

inputFields.name: fitnessCenter
inputFields.description: Show only hotels having fitness room.

inputFields.name: parking
inputFields.description: Show only hotels having any parking.

inputFields.name: freeParking
inputFields.description: Show only hotels having free parking.

inputFields.name: valetParking
inputFields.description: Show only hotels having valet parking.

inputFields.name: indoorPool
inputFields.description: Show only hotels having indoor swimming pool.

inputFields.name: petsAllowed
inputFields.description: Show only hotels having pets allowed.

inputFields.name: spa
inputFields.description: Show only hotels having spa.

inputFields.name: wifi
inputFields.description: Show only hotels having wifi.

inputFields.name: currency
inputFields.description: Three-letters ISO 4217 currency code, e.g. EUR or USD

fields.name: price
fields.description: Total price for all guests and nights and in the hotel. (including VAT)

fields.name: originalId
fields.description: Original block ID used to open Booking.com page.

fields.name: minimalPrice
fields.description: Base price for the room in this configuration.

fields.name: isBreakfastIncluded
fields.description: Is breakfast included in the hotelroom

fields.name: photos
fields.description: All available photos of the hotel room.

fields.name: roomSize
fields.description: The hotelroom size in square meters

types.name: Hotel
types.description: General information about the hotel.

fields.name: originalId
fields.description: Original (low level ID of the hotel). You are probably looking for "id" field.
fields.deprecationReason: Use field "id" instead. This field is used only because of compatibility reasons with old APIs.

fields.name: whitelabelUrl
fields.description: URL to our whitelabel page of this hotel.

fields.name: rating
fields.description: The star rating of the hotel.

fields.name: facilities
fields.description: All facilities available in the hotel.

fields.name: rooms
fields.description: All rooms available in the hotel.

fields.name: photos
fields.description: All available photos of the hotel.

fields.name: distanceFromCenter
fields.description: Hotel distance from the center in Km.

fields.name: stars
fields.description: Star rating is always in the interval 1-5 inclusive.

fields.name: score
fields.description: The review score of the hotel, in the range 1-10 inclusive.

fields.name: description
fields.description: The review score of the hotel in words.

fields.name: count
fields.description: The number of reviews of the hotel.

types.name: RootMutation
types.description: Root Mutation.

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name and description, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields` and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: Marks an element of a GraphQL schema as no longer supported.

args.name: reason
args.description: Explains why this element was deprecated, usually also including a suggestion for how to access supported similar data. Formatted in [Markdown](https://daringfireball.net/projects/markdown/).
